page.title: 11Shearing at Demesne Farm
page.content: In May the sheep are brought from the hill into the pen for shearing. A few sheep are transferred into a smaller pen. Richard opens the gate and Dad and Grandad bring one sheep onto the shearing board. The fleece is shorn off the sheep in such a way that it does not break. The sheep has JS printed on its back in red. I spread the fleece on the floor and pull the two long sides together into the middle. I roll the fleece up from the tail end (if I can tell which end is which), leaving a bit at the neck end. I twist this piece, pull it round the roll and tuck it under where it started. Then I put the fleece in the wool bag. Dad pays me 2p for each fleece I wrap. This year I made Â£1.02p.
